page_analysis.text_content:
Primary daylight plane (rear)

Fig 23 Side elevation showing Rear primary daylight plane

7.5' max. each protrusion    5' min. separation    7.5' max. each protrusion

Note: There is no front daylight plane

24' max. for protrusions

16'

24' max. for protrusions

Max. bldg. height

Setback line

Rear Yard

Rear lot line

Max building height is:
• 30' for structures w/roof slope < 12:12
• 33' for structures w/roof slope > 12:12
• 17' for structures on substandard or flag lots regardless of flood plane
• variable for structures located in flood zones except on substandard and flag lots - up to 33'

Cumulative length of protrusions must not exceed 15' on any one side.
Rear protrusions subject to same rules as side protrusions

Notes:
• Side daylight plane is measured (up) at lot line.
• Rear daylight plane is measured (up) at rear setback.

28

visual_elements.description: Side elevation architectural diagram showing a two-story house with dormers and various measurement annotations. The diagram illustrates the rear primary daylight plane with angular lines extending upward at 60-degree angles from the setback line. The building shows windows, siding details, and foundation elements.

technical_specifications.parameter: Maximum building height (substandard or flag lots)
Maximum building height (flood zones, except substandard/flag lots)
Maximum cumulative length of protrusions per side

additional_notes: Page number 28 appears at bottom left
Asterisk symbols (*) are used to mark specific measurement points and reference notes
Dashed lines indicate the daylight plane boundaries
The diagram uses different shading to distinguish building elements from measurement lines
cross_references: Fig 23 Side elevation showing Rear primary daylight plane
